meaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> breaks your <radical>bone</radical>s, not from hitting you, but from making the ground <kanji>slippery</kanji>. The water from the tsunami made all the sidewalks and stairs too slippery to walk on, but you tried anyway, slipped, and broke a couple bones.
readingMnemonic: As you struggle on the <kanji>slippery</kanji> ground you hear a loud yowling sound. You turn and see a bunch of stray <reading>cats</reading> (かつ) slipping and sliding too. They're coming right for you, uh oh!
